extendedIngredients.name: whole wheat elbow pasta
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 16 ounce boxes whole wheat elbow pasta

extendedIngredients.name: you can make your own
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 tsp cajun seasoning, or you can make your own

recipes.title: Mixed pepper mac and cheese

winePairing.pairingText: Lambrusco, Chenin Blanc, and Riesling are great choices for Macaroni and Cheese. With rich, cheesy mac & cheese you'll want to cleanse the palate with something crisp and acidic. We recommend Chenin Blanc, Riesling, or dry Lambrusco if you're in the mood for a red. The Molo 8 Lambrusco Mantovano with a 4.3 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 12 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Molo 8 Lambrusco Mantovano
productMatches.description: Intense ruby red. The bouquet is persistent and fragrant with hints of black cherries and wild berries. On the palate the wine is aromatic, fruity and pleasantly sweet.Ideal for cheese, ham, salami, pork or cold cuts and most dishes.

recipes.instructions: Prepare the pasta according to package instructions. Under cook the pasta for a couple of minutes as it will cook further in the oven.In a non-stick skillet place one tablespoon of olive oil and place the peppers. Cook them until soft, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.Meanwhile, in your food processor place the sauce ingredients and pulse until well combined. Preheat your oven to 375F.Transfer the cooked pasta and veggies to a large rectangular 9x13 ceramic baking dish followed by the sauce. Mix all the ingredients until the pasta is well covered with the sauce. Cover the dish with foil paper to avoid some of the pasta in the top to dry out. Bake at 375 F for 20-25 minutes.Serve immediately.TIP: You can mix panko breadcrumbs, herbs and olive oil and sprinkle over the top of the mac and cheese at the end of the baking time. Broil for two minutes on high for some added crunch.

steps.step: Prepare the pasta according to package instructions. Under cook the pasta for a couple of minutes as it will cook further in the oven.In a non-stick skillet place one tablespoon of olive oil and place the peppers. Cook them until soft, about 5 minutes.
Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.Meanwhile, in your food processor place the sauce ingredients and pulse until well combined. Preheat your oven to 375F.
Transfer the cooked pasta and veggies to a large rectangular 9x13 ceramic baking dish followed by the sauce.
Mix all the ingredients until the pasta is well covered with the sauce. Cover the dish with foil paper to avoid some of the pasta in the top to dry out.

Serve immediately.TIP: You can mix panko breadcrumbs, herbs and olive oil and sprinkle over the top of the mac and cheese at the end of the baking time. Broil for two minutes on high for some added crunch.
